programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/17/15. Anthony Bourdain explores the island nation of Madagascar, where he visits the capital city of Tana and samples Malagasy cuisine.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 04/26/15. Anthony Bourdain returns to Korea after 10 years to experience hyper-modern Seoul, and taste Korean fried chicken, vintage army stew and Kimchi.

programme.title: American Style
programme.desc: Aired 01/20/2019. The Reagan era brought in optimism, which led to extravagance and greed, as brands capitalize on spending and Wall Street capitalizes on the public.

programme.title: American Style
programme.desc: Aired 01/20/2019. As the millennium came to an end, women made strides in the workplace and in media. In the 2000s, the internet brought drastic changes to American life.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.sub-title: Where Do We Even Start With White Supremacy?
programme.desc: Aired 7/19/2020. Having met with the Ku Klux Klan in the first episode of United Shades five years ago, Kamau takes a deeper look into the damaging systemic applications of white supremacy in the United States. Through the lens of Pittsburgh and its local black leaders, writers and activists, Kamau investigates how this lauded progressive island masks a history of racism. Meeting with former leaders of the KKK and Nazis, as well as CNN correspondent Sara Sidner, Kamau examines the larger upwelling of national and international hate rhetoric in the current political era; an upwelling that led to the murder of eleven Jewish worshipers at Pittsburgh’s Tree of Life synagogue.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 7/26/2020. Kamau is thrown into the strenuous work of independent farming in Oklahoma. As he travels across the state, he examines the once-thriving history of Black farmers who through racist economic and social practices, have been largely lost to time. He also talks to independent farmers who now face that same fate at the hands of international consolidation, political posturing and economic disparity. He discovers that the power of land ownership and representation is critical in the efforts to provide safe, reliable and accessible food for our nation.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 8/2/2020. W. Kamau Bell explores inequities in the public education system through two very different school districts near Cleveland, Ohio. He sees how one district strives for students to rise above their economic circumstances while the other confronts the U.S.-wide racial achievement gap. In both districts, Kamau hears from students and teachers who are having these difficult conversations.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/03/15. Anthony Bourdain gets a taste of Miami with cow foot soup in Little Haiti and a personal lesson on sights and sounds from musician Questlove.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/10/15. Anthony Bourdain visits one of his favorite cities in Europe — Glasgow— where he makes his first stop at the Old College Bar for a pint.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown
programme.desc: Aired 05/17/15. Anthony Bourdain explores the island nation of Madagascar, where he visits the capital city of Tana and samples Malagasy cuisine.

programme.title: United Shades of America
programme.desc: Aired 8/9/2020. Kamau takes a look at the state of working America today. Across the U.S., the fastest-growing category of new jobs is gig work, spurred on by tech companies and their never-ending stream of apps. In the gig economy, low and uncertain incomes have replaced benefits, health care, and all the other worker's rights the labor movement fought for.

programme.title: American Style
programme.desc: Aired 01/13/2019. During a time of unprecedented expansion in prosperity and consumerism, America felt pressure for conformity as paranoia set in over a growing cold war.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/1/2022. Stanley Tucci visits the Veneto, once the center of a world-trading empire, and home to the "Floating City," Venice. Stanley explores the ingenuity of the Venetians, who have embraced the unexpected delights and challenges of the lagoon, in addition to the produce of Veneto’s fertile land. Veneto has a fascinating food culture due to its aquatic environment and the countless influences from around the world over throughout its vast and storied history.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/8/2022. Stanley Tucci visits the region that made the dream of unified Italy a reality. Piedmont boasts refined French heritage and precious peasant traditions. Once the engine room of Italian industrialization, Piedmont is now spearheading a slow food revolution. Between reimagined risotto and the elusive white truffle, Stanley will discover a region with an illustrious past but with its sights firmly set on the future.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/15/2022. Stanley Tucci visits Umbria, nicknamed The Green Heart of Italy. While this small, predominantly rural region lives in the shadow of its more glamourous neighbor, Tuscany, Umbria has an ancient history that predates even the Romans. And, with the highest consumption of pork per capita, Umbria is a carnivore’s dream. From wild boar hunts to incredible black truffle farms, Stanley will explore the riches this land has to offer, while also questioning whether old traditions and centuries of religious orthodoxy are preventing younger generations from breaking through.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 2/16/2020. Following King George’s death, Prince Edward must choose between the throne and marrying American divorcee, Wallis Simpson.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 2/23/2020. When the shy, stuttering George VI is crowned King in 1937, he must rebuild the prestige of the monarchy after the shocking abdication of his brother Edward and in the shadow of WWII.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 3/1/2020. As the young Elizabeth II takes her first steps as Queen, she is torn between old tradition and those, like her husband, who want to modernize the monarchy.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 3/8/2020. Prince Charles is next in line to succeed his mother, Queen Elizabeth, and is under great pressure to marry and produce an heir for the Windsor dynasty.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.sub-title: The Princess, the Prince & the Press
programme.desc: Aired 3/22/2020. The marriage between the Prince and Princess of Wales starts to fall apart and the Queen begins to face the greatest challenges of her long reign.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/22/2022. Stanley Tucci sets out to explore how Italian immigration has transformed the food scene in his adopted hometown of London. Forget what you think you know about this city. London is a culinary mecca where Italian food from every region gets a chance to shine. The burrata is so creamy and pasta is so fresh that it may rival Italy itself. For over a century, Italians here have found inventive ways to create Italian food so good it’s enough to render Stanley speechless.

programme.title: Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy
programme.desc: Aired 5/1/2022. Stanley Tucci visits the Veneto, once the center of a world-trading empire, and home to the "Floating City," Venice. Stanley explores the ingenuity of the Venetians, who have embraced the unexpected delights and challenges of the lagoon, in addition to the produce of Veneto’s fertile land. Veneto has a fascinating food culture due to its aquatic environment and the countless influences from around the world over throughout its vast and storied history.

Once the engine room of Italian industrialization, Piedmont is now spearheading a slow food revolution. Between reimagined risotto and the elusive white truffle, Stanley will discover a region with an illustrious past but with its sights firmly set on the future.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 3/29/2020. With the marriages of Prince William to Kate Middleton and Prince Harry to Meghan Markle, a new generation re-energizes the royal brand. But in the modern media age, the pressures of being a royal are more intense than ever.

programme.title: The Windsors: Inside the Royal Dynasty
programme.desc: Aired 2/16/2020. Following King George’s death, Prince Edward must choose between the throne and marrying American divorcee, Wallis Simpson.
